Table of Contents

Interface IArticleRepository

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Repositories
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Repository interface for managing Article domain entities. Provides comprehensive data access operations including CRUD, specialized queries, bulk status updates, duplicate detection, pagination, search, and maintenance tasks.

public interface IArticleRepository : IRepository<Article>
Inherited Members
IRepository<Article>.FirstOrDefaultAsync(Expression<Func<Article, bool>>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.AnyAsync(Expression<Func<Article, bool>>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.CountAsync(CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.DeleteByIdAsync(int, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.InsertOrUpdateAsync(Article, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.InsertAllAsync(IEnumerable<Article>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.UpdateAllAsync(IEnumerable<Article>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Article>.DeleteAllAsync(CancellationToken)

Remarks

This repository serves as the primary persistence abstraction for articles in the RSS reader application. It encapsulates all database interactions related to articles, ensuring separation from business logic and enabling testability (e.g., via in-memory or mock implementations).

Core responsibilities and behavioral expectations:

  • All write operations should be atomic and transactional where appropriate.
  • Read operations must use indexed columns (FeedId, Status, Guid, ContentHash) for efficiency.
  • Existence and count checks must avoid loading full entities (use scalar queries).
  • Bulk operations are optimized for sync/import/cleanup scenarios.
  • Methods that affect unread counters should trigger recalculation in the implementation.

GetWhereAsync(Expression<Func<Article, bool>>, CancellationToken)

Filters articles using a server-side predicate expression.

Task<List<Article>> GetWhereAsync(Expression<Func<Article, bool>> predicate, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

predicate Expression<Func<Article, bool>>

Lambda expression used to filter articles (e.g., a => a.FeedId == 5).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<List<Article>>

A list of articles that match the predicate.

Remarks

This method executes filtering at the database level for optimal performance.
